verses.text: When thou \w sittest|strong="H3427"\w* to \w eat|strong="H3898"\w* with a \w ruler|strong="H4910"\w*, \w consider|strong="H0995"\w* \w diligently|strong="H0995"\w* what \add is\add* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* thee:
And \w put|strong="H7760"\w* a \w knife|strong="H7915"\w* to thy \w throat|strong="H3930"\w*, if thou \add be\add* a man \w given|strong="H1167"\w* to \w appetite|strong="H5315"\w*.
Be not \w desirous|strong="H0183"\w* of his \w dainties|strong="H4303"\w*: for they \add are\add* \w deceitful|strong="H3577"\w* \w meat|strong="H3899"\w*.
\w Labour|strong="H3021"\w* not to be \w rich|strong="H6238"\w*: \w cease|strong="H2308"\w* from thine own \w wisdom|strong="H0998"\w*.

Wilt thou \w set|strong="H5774"\w* thine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* upon that which is not? for \add riches\add* \w certainly|strong="H6213"\w* \w make|strong="H6213"\w* themselves \w wings|strong="H3671"\w*; they fly \w away|strong="H5774"\w* as an \w eagle|strong="H5404"\w* toward \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w*.\f + \fr 23.5 \ft set…: Heb. cause thine eyes to fly upon\f*

\w Eat|strong="H3898"\w* thou not the \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* of \add him that hath\add* an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w eye|strong="H5869"\w*, neither \w desire|strong="H0183"\w* thou his dainty \w meats|strong="H4303"\w*:

For as he \w thinketh|strong="H8176"\w* in his \w heart|strong="H5315"\w*, so \add is\add* he: \w Eat|strong="H0398"\w* and \w drink|strong="H8354"\w*, \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* he to thee; but his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \add is\add* not with thee.

The \w morsel|strong="H6595"\w* \add which\add* thou hast \w eaten|strong="H0398"\w* shalt thou vomit \w up|strong="H6958"\w*, and \w lose|strong="H7843"\w* thy \w sweet|strong="H5273"\w* \w words|strong="H1697"\w*.

\w Speak|strong="H1696"\w* not in the \w ears|strong="H0241"\w* of a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w*: for he will \w despise|strong="H0936"\w* the \w wisdom|strong="H7922"\w* of thy \w words|strong="H4405"\w*.

\w Remove|strong="H5253"\w* not the \w old|strong="H5769"\w* \w landmark|strong="H1366"\w*; and \w enter|strong="H0935"\w* not into the \w fields|strong="H7704"\w* of the \w fatherless|strong="H3490"\w*:\f + \fr 23.10 \ft landmark: or, bound\f*
For their \w redeemer|strong="H1350"\w* \add is\add* \w mighty|strong="H2389"\w*; he shall \w plead|strong="H7378"\w* their \w cause|strong="H7379"\w* with thee.

\w Apply|strong="H0935"\w* thine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* unto \w instruction|strong="H4148"\w*, and thine \w ears|strong="H0241"\w* to the \w words|strong="H0561"\w* of \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*.

\w Withhold|strong="H4513"\w* not \w correction|strong="H4148"\w* from the \w child|strong="H5288"\w*: for \add if\add* thou \w beatest|strong="H5221"\w* him with the \w rod|strong="H7626"\w*, he shall not \w die|strong="H4191"\w*.
Thou shalt \w beat|strong="H5221"\w* him with the \w rod|strong="H7626"\w*, and shalt \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* his \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* from \w hell|strong="H7585"\w*.

My \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, if thine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* be \w wise|strong="H2449"\w*, my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* shall \w rejoice|strong="H8055"\w*, even \w mine|strong="H0589"\w*.\f + \fr 23.15 \ft even…: or, even I will rejoice\f*
Yea, my \w reins|strong="H3629"\w* shall \w rejoice|strong="H5937"\w*, when thy \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* right \w things|strong="H4339"\w*.

Let not thine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \w envy|strong="H7065"\w* \w sinners|strong="H2400"\w*: but \add be thou\add* in the \w fear|strong="H3374"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* all the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* long.
For surely there \w is|strong="H3426"\w* an \w end|strong="H0319"\w*; and thine \w expectation|strong="H8615"\w* shall not be cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w*.\f + \fr 23.18 \ft end: or, reward\f*
\w Hear|strong="H8085"\w* thou, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, and be \w wise|strong="H2449"\w*, and \w guide|strong="H0833"\w* thine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* in the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*.
Be not among \w winebibbers|strong="H3196"\w*; among riotous \w eaters|strong="H2151"\w* of \w flesh|strong="H1320"\w*:\f + \fr 23.20 \ft of flesh: Heb. of their flesh\f*

For the \w drunkard|strong="H5433"\w* and the \w glutton|strong="H2151"\w* shall come to \w poverty|strong="H3423"\w*: and \w drowsiness|strong="H5124"\w* shall \w clothe|strong="H3847"\w* \add a man\add* with \w rags|strong="H7168"\w*.

\w Hearken|strong="H8085"\w* unto thy \w father|strong="H0001"\w* that \w begat|strong="H3205"\w* thee, and \w despise|strong="H0936"\w* not thy \w mother|strong="H0517"\w* when she is \w old|strong="H2204"\w*.

\w Buy|strong="H7069"\w* the \w truth|strong="H0571"\w*, and \w sell|strong="H4376"\w* \add it\add* not; \add also\add* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, and \w instruction|strong="H4148"\w*, and \w understanding|strong="H0998"\w*.

The \w father|strong="H0001"\w* of the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w* shall \w greatly|strong="H1524"\w* \w rejoice|strong="H1523"\w*: and he that \w begetteth|strong="H3205"\w* a \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add child\add* shall have \w joy|strong="H8055"\w* of him.
Thy \w father|strong="H0001"\w* and thy \w mother|strong="H0517"\w* shall be \w glad|strong="H8055"\w*, and she that \w bare|strong="H3205"\w* thee shall \w rejoice|strong="H1523"\w*.
My \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, \w give|strong="H5414"\w* me thine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, and let thine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* \w observe|strong="H7521"\w* my \w ways|strong="H1870"\w*.

For a \w whore|strong="H2181"\w* \add is\add* a \w deep|strong="H6013"\w* \w ditch|strong="H7745"\w*; and a strange \w woman|strong="H5237"\w* \add is\add* a \w narrow|strong="H6862"\w* \w pit|strong="H0875"\w*.

She also lieth in \w wait|strong="H0693"\w* as \add for\add* a \w prey|strong="H2863"\w*, and \w increaseth|strong="H3254"\w* the \w transgressors|strong="H0898"\w* among \w men|strong="H0120"\w*.\f + \fr 23.28 \ft as for…: or, as a robber\f*

Who hath \w woe|strong="H0188"\w*? who hath \w sorrow|strong="H0017"\w*? who hath \w contentions|strong="H4079"\w*? who hath \w babbling|strong="H7879"\w*? who hath \w wounds|strong="H6482"\w* without \w cause|strong="H2600"\w*? who hath \w redness|strong="H2448"\w* of \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*?
They that tarry \w long|strong="H0309"\w* at the \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*; they that \w go|strong="H0935"\w* to \w seek|strong="H2713"\w* mixed \w wine|strong="H4469"\w*.

\w Look|strong="H7200"\w* not thou upon the \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* when it is \w red|strong="H0119"\w*, when it \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* his \w colour|strong="H5869"\w* in the \w cup|strong="H3563"\w*, \add when\add* it \w moveth|strong="H1980"\w* itself \w aright|strong="H4339"\w*.

At the \w last|strong="H0319"\w* it \w biteth|strong="H5391"\w* like a \w serpent|strong="H5175"\w*, and \w stingeth|strong="H6567"\w* like an \w adder|strong="H6848"\w*.\f + \fr 23.32 \ft an…: or, a cockatrice\f*

Thine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* shall \w behold|strong="H7200"\w* strange \w women|strong="H2114"\w*, and thine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* shall \w utter|strong="H1696"\w* perverse \w things|strong="H8419"\w*.

Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth \w down|strong="H7901"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, or as he that \w lieth|strong="H7901"\w* upon the \w top|strong="H7218"\w* of a \w mast|strong="H2260"\w*.\f + \fr 23.34 \ft the midst…: Heb. the heart of the sea\f*

They have \w stricken|strong="H5221"\w* me, \add shalt thou say, and\add* I was not \w sick|strong="H2470"\w*; they have \w beaten|strong="H1986"\w* me, \add and\add* I \w felt|strong="H3045"\w* \add it\add* not: when shall I \w awake|strong="H6974"\w*? I will \w seek|strong="H1245"\w* it \w yet|strong="H3254"\w* again.\f + \fr 23.35 \ft I felt…: Heb. I knew it not\f*
